Posts.Content: Newporter, should I take it you are from Newport Beach? I am in Chico and it's a medical backwater. My plan is to move forward, the problem is that there are only three urologists in town, all the docs here are really clubby, and the one who examined me actually told me that an area of my prostate was "firmer" but didn't feel like cancer and said he hated to go ahead with biopsies and to return in a year. He never used the term nodule. When I got my written report he had written that I have a nodular prostate and that he had encouraged a biopsy and I declined, that he offered me a six month follow-up and I declined. His word against mine. I am actually very risk averse and will do what needs to be done. If he had suggested biopsy, I would have agreed that day. Now I obviously don't trust him and am worried that any of his local colleagues will circle the wagons. I don't trust the local docs to do the biopsy honestly or competently so I am going to have to move all of this to the Bay Area. UCSF is one of eleven designated centers of excellence for prostate cancer in the U. S. so I guess that is where I am going ASAP.
Posts.Title: New and Unsure

Posts.Title: New and Unsure

Posts.Content: Thanks for responding. I am just about 64. My location is a small city where medical care is often somewhat slipshod. I'm thinking that I may need to go down to UCSF, which is a center of excellence. It seems unlikely that the situation is dire yet.
Posts.Title: New and Unsure

Posts.Content: This looks like a great forum. I may be at the beginning of this journey. A recent urologist visit and PSA revealed a 'nodular prostate' yet my PSA is 1.7. The doc in question suggested a one year follow up but I am uncomfortable and seeking a second opinion form another urologist I like and trust. Dave

Posts.Title: New and Unsure

Posts.Content: Thanks guys. Another possibly relevant fact is that my PSA shoots WAY UP in cases of infection. For whatever that is worth. I'm sent my information to a urologist who has helped me with other things and does PC surgeries. He did a great job on my inflatable prosthesis and is very committed to quality of life and men's sexual lives. I will give him through Tuesday to respond and, if he hasn't, will contact UCSF.
